name: Days of Being Wild
description: Shot on CineStill 800t film, Jumbo Kingdom floating restaurant. Jumbo Kingdom consists of the Jumbo Floating Restaurant, and the adjacent Tai Pak Floating Restaurant, are a renowned tourist attraction in Aberdeen South Typhoon Shelter, within Hong Kong's Aberdeen Harbour. Over 30 million visitors have visited Jumbo Kingdom, including Queen Elizabeth II, John Wayne, Chad Garvin, David Bowie, Tom Cruise, Gwyneth Paltrow, Chow Yun Fat, Stephen Chow, Legend Tong Yiu San and Gong Li. The Jumbo Floating Restaurant appears in Jackie Chan's The Protector (1985), The God of Cookery (1996), Godzilla vs Destroyah, Infernal Affairs II and Contagion (2011). The Tai Pak Floating Restaurant was featured in Love Is a Many-Splendored Thing (1955) and Enter the Dragon (1973). The Sea Palace, another floating restaurant located in the same area, was featured in the 1960 The World of Suzie Wong, Enter the Dragon, Bons baisers de Hong Kong (1975) and James Bond film The Man with the Golden Gun (1974). The video game Sleeping Dogs features a mission set in a floating restaurant based on the Jumbo Floating Restaurant in a semi-fictionalized version of Hong Kong. On 1 March 2020, the restaurant announced it would be closed until further notice.
